source.name: chembl
source.description: A database of bioactive drug-like small molecules and bioactivities abstracted from the scientific literature.

source.name: gtopdb
source.description: The IUPHAR (International Union of Basic and Clinical Pharmacology)/BPS (British Pharmacological Society) Guide to PHARMACOLOGY database contains structures of small molecule ligands, peptides and antibodies, with their affinities at protein targets.

source.name: kegg_ligand
source.description: KEGG LIGAND is a composite DB consisting of COMPOUND, GLYCAN, REACTION, RPAIR, RCLASS, and ENZYME DBs, whose entries are identified by C, G, R, RP, RC, and EC numbers, respectively.
source.name_long: KEGG (Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes) Ligand

source.name: chebi
source.description: ChEBI is a freely available dictionary of molecular entities focused on 'small' chemical compounds

source.name: zinc
source.description: A free database of commercially-available compounds for virtual screening, provided by the Shoichet Laboratory in the Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).  [Irwin and Shoichet, J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2005;45(1):177-82]

source.name: emolecules
source.description: A free chemical structure search engine containing millions of public domain structures. Pricing, availabilities, and vendor information requires an eMolecules Plus subscription.

source.name: ibm
source.description: The data are provided by IBM-NIH and include all chemistry extracted by means of text and image mining from the patent corpus (USPTO, WIPO and EPO) for patent documents published through 31-12-2010. Identifiers in UniChem are IBM compound identifiers.
source.name_long: IBM strategic IP insight platform and the National Institutes of Health

source.name: fdasrs
source.description: The primary goal of the FDA/USP Substance Registration System (SRS) is to unambiguously define all substances present in regulated products. Once a substance has been defined, the SRS assigns a strong identifier that is permanently associated with the substance: a UNII (Unique Ingredient Identifier). This is a a non-proprietary, free, unique, unambiguous, nonsemantic, alphanumeric identifier based on a substances molecular structure and/or descriptive information.

source.name: surechembl
source.description: SureChEMBL automatically extracts chemistry from the full text of all major patent authorities. Compounds are derived from either chemical names found in text or in chemical depictions. All SureChEMBL compounds are included, except those failing UniChem loading rules.

source.name: pubchem_tpharma
source.description: A subset of the PubChem DB: from the original depositor 'Thomson Pharma'.

source.name: pubchem
source.description: A database of normalized PubChem compounds (CIDs) from the PubChem Database.

source.name: nikkaji
source.description: Nakkaji (The Japan Chemical Substance Dictionary) is an organic compound dictionary database prepared by the Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST).

source.name: metabolights
source.description: A database for Metabolomics experiments and derived information. The database is cross-species, cross-technique and covers metabolite structures and their reference spectra as well as their biological roles, locations and concentrations, and experimental data from metabolic experiments.

source.name: brenda
source.description: A comprehensive Enzyme Information system containing enzyme functional data extracted directly from the primary literature.
